required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adequate Insertion Depth of Dilator During Central Venous Catheterization
clinical_study.official_title: Adequate Insertion Depth of Dilator During Central Venous Catheterization Through the Right Internal Jugular Vein

brief_summary.textblock: For safe central catheterization, clinicians must be aware of adequate dilator insertion depth not to directly dilate the venous wall. The purpose of the study is to find out adequate insertion depth of the dilator during central venous catheterization through the internal jugular vein with the aid of real-time ultrasonography.

detailed_description.textblock: This randomized controlled trial is to compare the distance between the skin puncture site and the outside of anterior wall of the internal jugular vein measured by real-time ultrasonography with the conventional method which is routinely used in common clinical practice.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 Day (on the study day for each patient)
primary_outcome.description: hematoma from the vascular wall puncture by the dilator

secondary_outcome.measure: distance between skin puncture site and the outside of the anterior wall of the internal jugular vein
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 Day (on the study day for each patient)
secondary_outcome.description: distance between skin puncture site and the outside of the anterior wall of the internal jugular vein which will be measured by real-time ultrasonography

arm_group.description: In the modified Seldinger's maneuver, after guide-wire insertion into the right internal jugular vein, "we will measure the distance between the skin puncture site and the outside of anterior wall of the jugular vein. Next, we will insert the dilator on the guidewire by the measured length."
In the modified Seldinger's maneuver, after guide-wire insertion into the right internal jugular vein, "we will insert the dilator on the guidewire as commonly used method of the practitioners."

intervention.description: For soft tissue dilation just after guidewire insertion in central venous catheterization through the right internal jugular vein, investigators will measure the distance between the skin puncture site and outside of anterior wall of the vein with real-time ultrasonography in the measured depth group. Next, practitioner will insert the dilator by the measured length and continue to insert the central venous catheter. For the conventional group as a control group, practitioner will perform the central venous catheterization with a manner used routinely by the practitioner.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients requiring central venous catheterization through the right internal jugular vein
Exclusion Criteria:
- suspicion for infection of the right neck site
